name: ListAlertGroupingSettings
description:
Retrieve all alert grouping settings.

Fetches all alert grouping settings, including single service and global content-based configurations, to help manage alert grouping effectively. Requires appropriate OAuth permissions.

parameters.name: accept_header_version
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API to accept responses from, using the `Accept` header for versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the response content. Typically set to 'application/json'.

parameters.name: next_page_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to retrieve the next page of results; use if more pages are available.

value_schema.description: Cursor to retrieve next page; only present if next page exists.

parameters.name: cursor_previous_page
parameters.description: Cursor to retrieve the previous page of results; only valid if not on the first page.

value_schema.description: Cursor to retrieve previous page; only present if not on first page.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of results to display per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: service_ids
parameters.description: An array of service IDs to filter results by specific services.

value_schema.description: An array of service IDs. Only results related to these services will be returned.

parameters.name: include_total_count
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the `total` field in pagination responses, or false for faster response times.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Cursor to retrieve previous page; only present if not on first page.

parameters.name: total

By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.
